data.title: Tween: fix non-repeat interpolate_callback
data.body: Tween: fix non-repeat interpolate_callback does not delete after call triggered

data.title: OptionButton text property doesn't load
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1 stable 64 bit, Windows 7

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
OptionButton text property filled through editor doesn't load. It is saved to scene but when you load it again, it doesn't show. Setting text property in GDScript works fine.

[Sample project](https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B8mFWyZk6SLEdU5Qc2ZoeHFQZmc)

data.title: Allow specifying exit value on quit()
data.body: Might be not useful in games per se, but will be very useful for automated testing.

data.body: Fixes #6325 name mismatch.

data.title: Variant::can_convert doesn't work for STRING ?
Fix Vector2.angle_to_point, atan2 arguments were reversed
Script editor right click menu Clear bug
data.body:
Godot version:  Godot_v2.1-stable_win64

Issue description: 

In the script editor right click menu there is an option to clear the whole script. When you click this there seem to be no way to recover your script. 

-all the undos seem to be wiped
-also if you close with out save, the gdscript text file is still cleared 

I lost a couple of hours of work, but if I was someone that did not back up stuff a lot, it could have been a disaster.  

video:  [https://youtu.be/6S7uuFptb0U]

data.title: SpinBox signal "mouse_enter" - it's incorrect works
data.body:
**OS All / Godot 2.1:**

![00000](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11189223/18079032/5edc9870-6e97-11e6-9b4a-588e026ca169.png)

In the screenshot I pointed out the green area of the component where the signal "mouse_enter" works, red area of the component where the signal "mouse_enter" does not work. I understand that the is a combined component. Nevertheless, I expect that the signal will work on the entire area of the component.

I attach the demo:
[DEMO.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/444194/DEMO.zip)

data.title: Variables are not updated on the runtime using Visual Scripting.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7, 64 bit. Godot Alpha v2.2 (http://www.purpleorangegames.com/godot/)
Also Windows 10, 64 bit.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
If I create a Variable, for example an INT variable with a value of 2 and I use this value on the viewport for example using a print node then I get 2 which is correct but if I edit the variable and I change it to 4 for example and I run the game again it keeps saying that is a value of 2. In order to fix this problem I need to completely delete the node from the viewport and add it back so that it forces the game to use the new value. It seems some sort of problem related to cache data or something. Quite ofter you need to delete nodes and add them back in order to force the engine to update the structure.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Read above.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Visual scripting nodes have flipped names
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7, 64 bit & Windows 10, 64 bit. Godot Alpha v2.2 (http://www.purpleorangegames.com/godot/)

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
The visual scripting nodes;  Get Variable and Set Variable seems to have flipped names. When adding a Get Variable node it shows: "Variable Set" and the node behaves as a node set, in the other side if you add a Set Variable node then the node looks like a get node instead.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Just add one get variable node and one set variable node, it's clear that they seem to be flipped in their names.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Fixed compilation
PinJoint2D's  Softness = 0 doesn't firmly fix the bodies
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
OS X 10.10.3 Godot 2.1 stable official.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
On the composition of the #6314 issue changing the gravity scale from 0.1 to 20 produces a pendulum that at first strokes reduces its amplitude drastically. It is caused by the softness parameter that although it is zero (rigid) it still uses some kind of softness, causing the body loose its potential energy that it has at start. 

I expect the behavior of a friction-less pendulum (amplitude equal its initial position) but with higher frequency due to gravity scale.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Open issue #6314 and change gravity scale from 0.1 to 20

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
See #6314

data.title: Facebook SDK for Android
data.body:
Since networking is getting better in Godot, it is quite useful to have Facebook SDK, specially for Android.
It is a great tool for login and for finding players with ease.

https://developers.facebook.com/docs/android/

Thanks.

data.title: Windows: Hide the mouse cursor when MOUSE_MODE_CAPTURED is activated.
data.body:
The reference of the [Input class](http://docs.godotengine.org/en/latest/classes/class_input.html#numeric-constants) constants states:

> **MOUSE_MODE_CAPTURED**: Captures the mouse. The mouse will be hidden and unable to leave the game window. But it will still register movement and mouse button presses.

This pull request will hide the mouse cursor on `Input.set_mouse_mode(MOUSE_MODE_CAPTURED)` and shows it on `Input.set_mouse_mode(MOUSE_MODE_VISIBLE)`.

data.title: Tilemap bucket tool doesn't works with eraser
data.body: I tried to erase tiles with the Bucket tool and RMB, but it does nothing. I would like to be able to "fill" an area with empty tiles (as such, I don't mean transparent dummy tiles, but actual removal of them).

data.title: 2D Sprite Mesh Deform / FFD [FeatureReq]
data.body: Godot already has good IK bone tool, which is great but most of the new gen mobile games uses FFD to morph bone sprites which gives the animation life like quality. Is there a future plan to add engine feature for 2D FFD for sprites or support for such animator format(json) like DragonBone(Open Source, Great Quality) ?

data.title: Zoom in and out using mouse scroll wheel
data.body: it does what the buttons do but using the scroll wheel, closes #6168

data.title: Visual Script Minimap
data.body: Since visual scripts tend to grow very fast, a minimap  could be useful to easily navigate the script

data.title: updating image using Image.get_data()
Gravity factor = 0.1 causes ideal pendulum stop at not equilibrium point
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
OS X 10.10.3 Godot 2.1 stable official

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
A perfect pendulum (no friction) created with a PinJoint2D and a RigidBody2d and a capsule collision shape stops after first oscillation if gravity scale is 0.1. It starts rotated 90 degrees and stops after rotates 180 degrees in a non equilibrium position.

I expect that it would endless move like a pendulum.

**Steps to reproduce:**
See minimal exampled attached

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[Pendulum.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/441232/Pendulum.zip)

data.title: self in setget
data.body: I have the feeling that using `self.` is kind of expensive but I like using `self.` because it gives me clear code. Anyway, I wanted to use `setget` for some experimentation and I found that I am unable to use `self.` in these functions giving an error such as `Parser Error: Must use 'vel_max' instead of 'self.vel_max' in setter.`. Why is that? And can this be "fixed"? I say "fixed" cause I see this is a GDScript compilation error so I guess this is the intended behavior but it doesn't make sense to have `self.` available everywhere except in this one place. I think it's a usability flaw. I know it's minor thing :D

data.title: Fix release build.
data.body:
This pull request does the following:
-  **variant_call.cpp:** make the members`arg_names` + `return_type` also available for the release build.
- **visual_script_nodes.cpp:** move single`}`outside of the `#ifdef DEBUG_ENABLED` ... `#endif`.

This should fix #6134  + #6291.

@reduz please check if this is okay for you.

data.title: Object.get_property_list ignore internal class
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
get_property_list doesn't return Reference's fields

**Steps to reproduce:**

```
func _ready():
    var test = Test.new()
    print(test.get_property_list()) # [(hint:0), (hint_string:), (name:Reference), (type:0), (usage:256)]

class Test:
    var a = 10
    var b = "test"
    var c = true
```
